ratings.comment: Absolutely awful.... however test are easy compared to other classes; the reason the curve is so low is because everyone is stupid from learning with him. DON'T DO IT. Use class time to go to the library and teach your self, he reads verbatim out of the book anyways and if at all possible sit in on Yoon's lectures and you might learn something.

Probably one of the worst professors I have ever had. You can not understand when he speaks, he can't write on the board, and his exams are brutal. My advice is to read and memorize the books. He shows you reactions but not WHY they occur, which is what you need to know...Good Luck! Pick a different professor if possible...
God Awful!

DINOSAUR. This man should be retired. Clearly knowledgeable, just as clear: not made for teaching. His chicken scratches on the board are useless, uses reagents not found in the book on tests. and he mumbles...A LOT. The curve ROCKS but you must be able to teach yourself or you're screwed.

Terrible... just terrible, worst "teacher" I have ever had, and that includes my forth grade teacher that punched my classmate for having TWO pairs of school scissors in his desk instead of just one (and than pushed him to the ground for crying about it).

He knows chemistry, but certainly doesn't know how to teach it.  Don't go to lecture, you won't be able to read the board or hear what he says.  If you can teach yourself, then take his class and benefit from the curve.

The worst professor I have ever had.  So you know I'm not a troll, I thought Reich was absolutely amazing and lucid. This man has incomprehensible lectures notes, conducts his lectures horribly (they're very difficult to follow), and he introduces a lot of material beyond what's in the textbook which complicates things further. Do not take.

This poor old man looks like he's going to fall over dead any minute! It's difficult to understand him in class because he mumbles and you can't always read his writing on the board. I think this man is loooong overdue for a peaceful retirement.

Do NOT take this professor! The worst teacher you will ever find. He mumbles the lesson to the board and makes mistakes often and on top of that the lessons don't make any logical sense. You'd be better off not coming to class and memorizing the textbook.

This professor has to be one of the worst if not the worst professor in history. He is a smart chemist but his teaching is awful, you would have a better chance learning chemistry of a bar napkin. He comes in with his chicken scratch tries slaps it up up on the board, mumbles scratches and leaves. His curves are generous, exams are ok.

oh my god he is the best professor at this school. he is so helpful, his lectures could not be more clear, he makes the class very easy to understand. i absolutely love going to lecture because of how good he presents material. he is a really awesome lecturer

The WORST professor ever!!! Avoid him at any cost. The lectures are a waste of time, in fact, they will confuse you even more. You can only survive this class if you are good at studying by yourself.He is absolutely uncomprehensible!

He is god awful. If you end up taking him don't bother attending lecture it won't help. The TA's notes are better than anything you can decipher from the blackboard. However if you're good at teaching yourself material take him because the averages are low and curves are respectable. Just know you will do it all on your own

absolutely awwwwwfuulllll!!!! completly useless for anything. i made the mistake of attending lecture in the hopes i might get something useful once but no luck. curve is super low so hopefully you're smarter than most. good luck

Clearly the worst professor I've had at UW. Just read your book if you want the information he teaches in lecture, since he copies it straight from the book anyway and you can actually READ what the book is writing. Exams are awful, averages are always ~50% but he then tells us how disappointed he is that we didn't do better because the exams are "not that hard." Spare yourself the pain.

He is probably the worst teacher i have had at this school. His tests are extremely hard, His lectures are not worth going to....during lecture he mumbles to himself at the blackboard and constantly makes mistakes in drawing mechanisms. If you enjoy your life, I beg you to avoid this professor.

This professor is almost comical, I want to videotape a lecture and use it as a "why you do not want to go to this school video". Lectures are useless, (copies syntheses from book in chicken scratch and mumbles)I spend more time trying to decipher what is written than learning it. He will then precede to tell you how bad you did on the exams....

Worst professor ever! Mumbles to himself constantly none of which is comprehensible and draws random reactions on the board most of which you cannot even begin to decipher. Eventually you will go crazy in his class and start seeing things in the structures he draws. My advice- read and memorize the book its your only hope to passing this class.

The worst professor ever! I am sure he is a good chemist, but an absolutely terrible teacher. The lectures are just a complete waste of time, because nothing is clear, he mumbles to himself and writes on the board,complaining how bad the book is.You can hardly hear anything. If you want to learn O.chem, avoid him at any cost.

As an instructor he is useless...he breathes hard every 3 seconds and nobody can hear him - he did put everything on the board. make sure you stay awake and copy his notes because exams are based on what he put on the board. Also, study and UNDERSTAND his practice exams because his exams are basically the same thing as his practices. Good luck! :(

Impossible to understand notes, must learn from book. If you understand that going in it's incredibly easy. Bottom 8% were Ds and Fs and that required ~20% scores on the exams. Averages were usually ~50% but material wasn't impossible, just nobody learned it. Nice guy if you talk to him. Ochem is hard, no professor is going to fix that.

A bit hard to understand during lecture and certain reactions on the board sometimes turned into one giant scribble(felt sorry for the TA's who had to take and post online notes). Exams are brutal but Nelsen's curve is very generous.  After the first 3 exams if you had 100pts total (out of 300)it was a BC haha

Nelsen is one of the professor who does not care about students at all. His exams are killer, please avoid him at any cost if you want a good grade and want to learn o.chem. His lectures were the most pointless lectures I have ever had for  science courses. He does not care if you can hear or read his writting on the board.

Having Nelson was my worst experience thus far at Madison. No reason to go to lecture. He hands out a "Need to Know for Exam" sheet and old exams which are the only way to study. Exams are painfull. I felt like dropping out after every one, but curve is fair. Take any other professor unless you want nightmares filled with ochem.

I only went to his class maybe 3 times in whole semester because you basically can't understand what he is saying (well, at least he writes it all out). Since everyone do poorly in his class, I do not think it is hard to get at least B. So if you are satisfied with that, take his class. Recommendation: Just study on your own.
Absolute WORST professor ever!  Avoid at all costs.  Completely incomprehensible.  Forget going to class, just memorize everything from the book.  Exams are murder, but doing old exam problems helps.

Nelsen tells you what you need to know in class, the trick is actually remembering it.  He shows up for review sessions two nights a week, which have a pitiful attendance.  I don't think people actually WANT to learn this stuff, and they blame Nelsen as an excuse.  He's really a patient, quality teacher if you listen up.

It's not at all hard to get a good grade in his class.  Going to lectures isn't neccessary, just stay home and memorize the book.  Average on tests is about 50/100, and it's curved fairly.  Just read the book and you'll be fine.  Also, he gives out old exam questions, some of which turn up on the exam.

WORST PROFESSOR EVER!! wheezes constantly so you cant hear what he's even saying, mumbles on top of it. exams are basically a foreign language. He shouldn't be allowed to teach because he's so bad. Don't take him unless you want to feel suicidal everytime you look at a reaction

Agree with everyone else. Worst experience I've had in my education thus far. Rambles, doesn't explain anything, boring as sin. Here's a lecture - read stuff off a sheet, write on chalkboard, fill up chalkboard, erase, repeat. For 50 minutes. No interaction with the class whatsoever. Face to face he seems like a great guy, but he's a terrible prof.

Nelsen is most likely the worst professor I have ever encountered. He just waddles into class and starts talking about material without giving any context whatsoever. The exams are like a death sentence, but he usually makes up for this with a pretty fair curve. I feel emotionally scarred after this course.

He is the worst teacher ive ever had. His lectures are so boring and not helpful. The tests are ridiculous. However, the curve is fair and I ended up with a B, but I had to work super hard and my average was round 50%
I agree with everything the person above said.  He is not a good teacher, you have to memorize it all from the book.  Avoid him if you can.

Lectures are boring and inconsistent with the text. He'll present chunks of material then say you don't have to know it. Genocides are gentler than his exams. Wheezes like he may drop dead in class. Writes tiny and too close together. Curve is fair. Practice exams helped somewhat. No req'd HW or quizzes. it's ochem :/
